SVGLength.summary: The SVGLength interface correspond to the <length> basic data type.

remarks.para: An SVGLength object can be designated as read only, which means that attempts to modify the object will result in an exception being thrown.

SVGLengthConvertToSpecifiedUnits.summary: The convertToSpecifiedUnits() method of the interface allows you to convert the length's value to the specified unit type.

SVGLengthNewValueSpecifiedUnits.summary: The newValueSpecifiedUnits() method of the interface resets the value as a number with an associated , thereby replacing the values for all of the attributes on the object.

SVGLengthUnitType.summary: The unitType property of the interface that represents type of the value as specified by one of the SVG_LENGTHTYPE_* constants defined on this interface.

SVGLengthValue.summary: The value property of the interface represents the floating point value of the <length> in user units.

remarks.para: Setting this attribute will cause and to be updated automatically to reflect this setting.

SVGLengthValue.value: The length value in user units as a float.

SVGLengthValueAsString.summary: The valueAsString property of the interface represents the <length>'s value as a string, in the units expressed by .

remarks.para: Setting this attribute will cause , , and to be updated automatically to reflect this setting.

SVGLengthValueInSpecifiedUnits.summary: The valueInSpecifiedUnits property of the interface represents floating point value, in the units expressed by .

remarks.para: Setting this attribute will cause and to be updated automatically to reflect this setting.

SVGLengthValueInSpecifiedUnits.value: The numeric factor of the length as a float.
